text: A MAN -- rugged, square chin, hasn’t slept or shaven in d This is DREW THAYER (30s). He wears a thick coat, tries n to stand out. He’s not from around here. “Here” is a bleak, locals-only market surrounded by crumb Soviet-era buildings. Anemic vegetables. Dried meat. Fish Handmade woolens. This place isn’t in a Lonely Planet gui
Drew shouldn’t be out in public but he needs to eat. He glances around furtively as he buys a ROLL from a BAKER.

(Lithuanian) Thank you. He sees something in his periphery -- his gears turn -- k he'll have to run. Or fight. Probably both. He crosses to A table of sad Chernobyl-looking shit manned by a skinny LITTLE GIRL -- bootleg Snoopy alarm clock, filthy handmad dolls -- one man’s trash... Drew picks up a HAND MIRROR.

(broken English) Three Euro. Drew ignores her, uses the mirror to look behind him -- a FLOWER STAND there’s a THUG. Shaved head. Flat nose from repeated breaks. The kind of man who’d never buy you flow
(broken English) Two? I give you for two. Drew puts the mirror down and walks away.
One-fifty... ?

Colorful clothes sway as Drew slips behind them. The THUG appears... looks around... Then suddenly -- a STRIPED SCA ensnares his neck. Tightens, tightens -- Thug gasps for a Drew’s behind him -- he’s done this before -- Thug kicks, knocks over a table of mittens -- The AGING VENDOR SCREAM Then it’s over. Thug goes LIMP. Drew holds him by the wai with one hand, swiftly reaches the other to his belt. Pul out Thug’s HANDGUN and lets the dead body fall into a PUD

(Lithuanian) Savages! You pay for this mess! As Drew drops a stack of Euros onto her table... ANOTHER GUY jumps out. Probably his brother. Bigger -- if that’s possible. Drew FIRES -- but his target’s ready for and dives behind a BUTCHER’S STAND. Drew FIRES again... m of the bullets hit SALAMI. But his last bullet HITS the g CHEST. He falls. Drew calmly moves in to finish the job. Click. Gun’s empty. Fuck. As the guy gasps for life, goes for his own gun -- Drew y down a SALAMI, smacks the guy’s hand with it -- a makeshi bat -- then leaps onto his chest. With one hand, Drew hol the guy’s nose -- with the other, shoves the jagged, brok SALAMI DOWN THE GUY'S THROAT. Bad way to die. But at leas there’s no one coming after him now. Wait. Spoke too soon. From around the corner, a MAN with horrible 1994 haircut comes at Drew -- GUN BLASTING. Drew DUCKS. He WEAVES. Drew dives around the corner, disappear The GUNFIRE keeps coming...

The GUNFIRE now comes from DUCK HUNT -- the old Nintendo game. We’re in a retro arcade-themed bar and the shooter the ORANGE PLASTIC HANDGUN is AUDREY. She turns 27 today. decimates duck after duck, insanely good at this game. Unlike every female character in every other movie, Audre knows exactly how beautiful she is. Like a 7. Maybe an 8 she wasn’t wearing her tacky Hawaiian TRADER JOE’S UNIFOR
MORGAN (27), her best friend, walks over with TWO BEERS.

You can’t stand over here all night. Morgan’s parents always told her she could be anything, including a rocket scientist or a supermodel, if she want Morgan totally buys that. Girl has zero insecurities.
Why? I’m having a good time.
Because it’s your birthday party. Behind Audrey: some FRIENDS, a half-eaten supermarket cak

Right. And for my birthday, I want to stand in the corner and not talk to anyone who isn’t caught up on my life. Everyone’s gonna ask me what I’m up to cause that’s what you do, and I’1ll have to tell everyone that I’m not up to anything.
Audrey...

Look at me. I’m twenty-seven years old and I work at Trader Joe’s. I wear a Hawaiian shirt to work and I am neither Hawaiian nor Jimmy Buffett. Like, three years ago what I’m doing was considered “finding myself.” Now I’m suddenly at the age where people feel bad for me for doing the exact same thing.
Who feels bad for you? I’1l kill them.
My parents called today. They spent five seconds saying happy birthday, and the next forty-five minutes bragging about how my brother Adam is about to cure Cystic Fibrosis.
Fuck Cystic Fibrosis.
Actually, it’s a really serious disease. Adam has a huge heart. (sighing) And everyone’s gonna ask about Drew.
Fuck Drew. That guy was a dick.
You're just saying that to make me feel better. You never said that when we were together.
Well yeah. You can’t say shit about your friend’s current boyfriend. But dude, he dumped you in a text. Objectively, he suuuucks.
Or he just wasn’t in love with me.
Audrey, you control the narrative here. It’s all about spin. Look at me. Am I successful? Not in the conventional sense of being like, employed. But ask me what I'm doing with my life.
What?
Say, hey Morgan, what have you been up to lately?
(flat) Hey Morgan. What have you been up to lately?

Getting in touch with my gifts. Voice lessons. Stage combat. So no matter what roles come along in theater, film, or life’s journey itself, I'm ready. It's a beautiful thing as a woman to empower yourself like that, you know?
Okay that was amazing.
Hey, do I have your e-mail? My one woman show is really coming together. TESS (27) walks in. She’s anorexic, personality-free and huge cunt. (We’re taking back that word, sorry!)
Shit. It’s Tess. Don’t make me talk to Tess. She’s gonna do that thing she always does, where she gives me a bullshit compliment then pivots it into something super insulting.
Audrey. Spin. You got this. Here... She hands Audrey a tube of lipstick.
Put this on. Tell the world you’re trying. Ideally, you’d change out of your work clothes too but... Morgan walks away. Tess is now next to Audrey.
Hey lady! Oh my God, those earrings are so cute! Are those shells?
Yeah...

Where’s your adorable boyfriend? You guys are such a surprising couple! Audrey just... can’t. She takes the plastic gun from the game, puts it to her OWN TEMPLE. Pulls the trigger and dramatically FAKE DIES. Tess has no idea how to react.

Drew runs down stairs down to a rusty basement door. It’s locked. Drew turns, sprints back to an overflowing DUMPST He grabs a busted HAIR DRYER. This’1ll do. He bashes it o ground til the innards are exposed. Yanks out a HEATING C BACK AT THE DOOR -- Drew picks the lock with the coil. He fast. Walks in like he owns the place.

A tall LATEX-CLAD DOMINATRIX clicks a REMOTE CONTROL. Acr the room: a MAN suspended from a harness wearing only underwear, tattoos and piercings -- his nipples hooked up electrodes. He screams in pain/gratification. Nonplussed, Drew brushes past -- grabs a WHIP, CHAINS, an SPIKED COLLAR for later use. He shoves them into his jack

Upstairs, WOMEN IN LINGERIE work the early-morning shift. could catch herpes just by looking at them. Drew emerges the ANCIENT MADAM approaches, cigarette dangling. Drew ha her a wad of cash. He’s done this before.
(Lithuanian) Which one? Drew points to a young, thin, SPOOKED GIRL. She nods. Dre takes the spooked girl’s hand and she leads him upstairs.
Drew closes the door behind them. The girl starts to take her clothes, speaks in Broken English.
No. Keep them on. Drew pulls the SPIKED COLLAR out of his jacket. The Girl terrified. But Drew crosses to the WINDOW, opens it.
What you into?

(Lithuanian) I’m into you never saw me. With that, Drew hands her more money than she’s ever seen her life ($25 USD). Then turns the COLLAR upside down and loops it over the POWER LINE out the window. He jumps out
Drew ZIPLINES out of the brothel, over rooftops, and fina jumps off on a LANDING outside the open window of a --
TWO BORED TEENAGERS watch THE MINDY PROJECT dubbed in Lithuanian. They barely look up as Drew runs past them --
The MATRIARCH ladles BORSCHT from a pot. Seeing Drew, she SCREAMS and drops it, Pepto Bismol pink everywhere. SIREN WAIL in the distance.
(Lithuanian) Keys.
Drew whizzes down a COBBLESTONE STREET on a MOPED. TWO CO CARS round the corner, in hot pursuit.
Morgan sits at the bar, flirting with Eurotrash VIKTOR -- shaved head, Ukrainian football tracksuit.
Such a coincidence. I just auditioned to be a Ukrainian farm girl in a Geico spot. Wait, so is it "Ukraine" or “The Ukraine?"

You say how you like. Always let beautiful woman decide. Morgan swoons... then notices Audrey, head pressed mournf against the JUKEBOX. Draining her SCOTCH. She puts it on of the juke next to TWO OTHER EMPTIES. Morgan grimaces.
Hey, Viktor? Hold that thought. Morgan crosses to Audrey.
Why did I have my birthday here? This is where I met Drew.
Enough. After tonight, I never want to hear the name “Drew” again. Even if you, like, “drew” me a picture, you say “I painted you something with pencils.” You have to move on.
I know. It’s just kinda hard to do that when he left that box of shit in our apartment that I have to see every day. He won’t even text me back about picking it up.

Let me see your phone for a sec. Audrey hands her CELL over. Morgan finds the BREAKUP TEXT “Hey there -- it’s over. Sorry.” Morgan then scrolls through a series of UNANSWERED REPLIE from Audrey: Why / What are you... / Call me / WIF? / How you... Then she starts a NEW TEXT MESSAGE.
Who are you texting?
Drew. “Fuck you, you worthless pussy -- I’m setting your shit on fire.”
Why are you saying that?
Because we’re gonna go set his fucking shit on fire. I love setting things on fire.

Drew speeds through the decrepit, graffitied streets, ona mission. He parks behind a burnt out APARTMENT COMPLEX. He looks at his cell -- GRIMACES. Then rounds the corner sees something worse -- Three GIANT THUGS waiting for him Drew takes the long way around the building, stealthily pulling the WHIP and CHAINS from his jacket. He rounds th corner -- now behind the men -- and just STARTS SWINGING. seconds, all three men are bloody messes. Two knocked out the other moaning in pain. Drew steps over them. INT. AUDREY AND MORGAN’S FIRE ESCAPE - LOS ANGELES - NIGH

Typical L.A. stucco fourplex. Audrey and Morgan stand drunkenly on the fire escape over a BANKERS BOX of Drew’s stuff. Morgan holds a bottle of LIGHTER FLUID. Audrey gingerly picks up a pair of BOXER BRIEFS.
Really Drew? Skid marks on your underwear? Are you eight? Was I supposed to wash this for you? Is that why you dumped me? I didn’t mother you enough?
Fuck you and wipe your own ass! Next, Audrey picks up a small PLASTIC TROPHY shaped like VICTORIOUS FOOTBALL PLAYER. The plaque reads: SECOND PLAC
Your Fantasy Football trophy for SECOND place? And you saved it?
It’s not even real football. It’s a fucking fantasy.

And I'm a real fucking person. So if you think you’re gonna get some supermodel who also has nothing better to do with her time than blow you while you watch the game... uh, fuck you. Morgan pulls out a STRAIGHT TO DVD SPY ACTION MOVIE.
Um, speaking of fantasy, say goodbye to your straight-to-DVD shitty action movie starring Ryan Phillipe and Mischa Barton!
That you forced me to watch with you. I will never get those 82 minutes back. There’s like one review on the cover. Three and a half stars from JeffreyLovesMovies.com?!

And you got it used at Chevron? Really Drew? You walked into a gas station and you’re like, yes! One copy of “Marked Target” please. Here’s $3.99. Morgan pours LIGHTER FLUID all over the box and its conte She hands Audrey a matchbox.
You do the honors, birthday girl. Audrey takes the matches. We’re CLOSE on the MATCH LIGHTING... and then... BUZZ. Her cell, in her pocket. Audrey shakes out the match and pulls out her phone...
It’s... Drew.

Hey. INT. DREW’S SHITTY VILNIUS APARTMENT - INTERCUT Not a place you’d want to spend the night in. Peeling wal roaches, bare light bulb. Drew paces, earpiece in, checki the SURVEILLANCE SCREENS by his bed.
Really? That’s it? “Hey?”
Audrey, I'm so sorry. I fucked up.
Tell him to go fuck himself.
I'll come by your place tomorrow. I can explain everything... and I’1l get the stuff I left there.

(annoyed) So that’s why you called? Just to get your shit back? Awesome.  10. She awaits a response. But Drew’s busy PUNCHING THE DRYWA by his night stand. In the hole: a SECRET STASH of MONEY, PASSPORTS and GUNS. Drew stuffs it in his POCKETS.

It’s my birthday, by the way. Drew hears a GUN COCK. Someone’s behind him. ON AUDREY: The line goes DEAD. ON DREW -- spinning around -- knocking the gun from his attacker, an OLDER THUG. They know each other. No weapons now. They punch and kick, equally matched.
Fight me all you want but you have more problems coming. You know what they want.
They’re not getting it.
They’11 get it when you’re dead.
I can handle dead. Can you? Drew PINS the old thug to the floor with one hand. CRACKS NECK with the other. Drew shakes off the body and moves t
Drew pulls a bag of MICROWAVE POPCORN from an almost-bare cupboard. Then, from the hole in the wall, delicately --
Drew affixes it to the bag of NEWMAN’S OWN (in Cyrillic), tosses it in the microwave, presses the POPCORN SETTING. popcorn STARTS POPPING...
Drew walks away from his building as his apartment EXPLOD In the flames, our title:
A year ago. Audrey, happier, before her heartbreak. She’s the jukebox, flipping. She’s lightly bumped on the back.
Sorry.  11. Audrey turns, notices DREW behind her. Back then he was c shaven, like any guy you’d see in a Silver Lake bar.
That’s okay. Audrey’s wears a “HAPPY BIRTHDAY” PARTY STORE TIARA.
Oh. Hey. Happy birthday.
What? (off tiara, deadpan) Oh, this? It’s not my birthday. I just wear this for warmth.
Well, if it was your birthday, I would say happy birthday.
And I would say thank you. A moment. They’re clearly feeling a vibe. AUDREY (CONT’D) Hey, can I get your help with something really really important?
I do consider myself a problem- solver.
I have one quarter left. Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to find the absolute worst song on this jukebox. Drew smiles, joins her.
Audrey snaps out of the memory, hands a CUSTOMER a RECEIP She’s at her shitty CASHIER JOB at Trader Joe’s.

Thank you. Have a great day. Audrey notices her reflection in a MIRROR by the register She looks hung over. Remembering Morgan’s words, she pull out the LIPSTICK and applies it. Almost immediately -- SEBASTIAN HENSHAW (30) -- shirt, tie, charming, British - steps to her register. With NO GROCERIES. Audrey’s confus  12.
Can I help you?
Yes... one gum please. He hastily grabs the nearest pack of GUM and hands her a dollar. As Audrey rings him up.
Have a nice day.
...Sebastian. Aren’t you going to ask me if I need help to my car? Audrey smiles. He’s flirting with her. Well, look at that
Audrey follows Sebastian to a far corner of the parking l
So, where are you from?
England.
That’s what I thought. But sometimes when I think that, people end up being Australian.
(amused) People do sometimes end up being Australian.
Shut up. (then, flustered) Sorry, I didn’t really mean shut up. It’s a figure of speech. I dunno if you do that in England...
Figures of speech? We invented that.
Some would say I’m not exercising good judgment, following a strange man through a parking lot. I mean, this is how people get shoved into the back of sketchy vans, right?  13.
(dead serious) Get in the van.
What? REVEAL Sebastian’s stopping in front of a BLACK VAN with TINTED WINDOWS. The DOOR OPENS from the inside. Sebastian flashes a BADGE.
Federal agent.
The van moves. Sebastian faces Audrey. Next to him is TOP PATEL (30) -- a smarmy jerk. Audrey is beyond freaked out
What's going on? Am I in trouble? I didn't do anything wrong.
There’s nothing to be afraid of, Ms. Stockman.
Says the guy who just kidnapped me. And knows my name. Oh my God what the fuck is happening... ?
We just want to talk. About Drew Thayer. He's your boyfriend, right?
(surprised) No. I mean he was. But we broke up. Why? Is he in trouble or something?
Yes. Drew is in a lot of trouble.
Do you know where your ex-boyfriend worked, Ms. Stockman?
Yeah. NPR. He has this podcast about... um, honestly, I’m not positive. The episode I listened to was about little-known composers of the 18th Century... well, I listened to most of it.  14.
Nobody listened to that podcast. Not even me and I went to Harvard.
Wow. Only took you two minutes. (flat) Patel went to Harvard.
That podcast was Drew’s cover job.
He never said anything about having another job.
That’s what “cover” means, hon.
Okay I know. I’m not stupid. I’m just... processing. This is a lot. What was it a cover for?
Drew was a CIA agent.
Wait, what?!
Then he stole things he shouldn’t have and killed people he shouldn't have. Now he’s on the run.
And if we don’t find him, a lot of innocent people are going to die. Do you want that to happen?

No! Jesus. No. Look, I’m with you that Drew’s an asshole. I just can't believe he’s... a killer. Sebastian pulls out a FOLDER of PHOTOS. Grainy surveillan pictures of Drew -- with guns, making a drop, stabbing a in the neck. Audrey gets more anxious as she flips throug
Oh my God. OH MY GOD. She stops at a photo of HERSELF with DREW, in VEGAS.
You guys were in Vegas when we saw Celine Dion? (MORE )
(quickly) Ironically. He hands her another photo. TWO DEAD BODIES by a CRAPS TA
Has Drew been in touch since you broke up? ON AUDREY - should she tell them?

No... well, yes. He called me last night. I mean, he called me back. Finally. I had called him like a thousand times. (self-conscious) After he disappeared. I called him a normal amount when we were together. I'm normal. INT. AUDREY’S APARTMENT - DAY An Ikea-filled two-bedroom. Audrey rushes in, still in he uniform (she’1l continue to be until we say otherwise.)
Morgan! Morgan! Morgan emerges from the kitchen in her bra and underwear, phone call. Peeling and eating string cheese.
...Yeah, Mom. Audrey just got home.
I have to talk to you.
Dude, I have to talk to you. I slept with Viktor.
Who?
From your birthday party. Behind her, Viktor emerges in nothing but RED LYCRA BRIEF He kisses Morgan intensely, then grabs a sleeve of CRACKE
I will hit shower, yes? He heads into the bathroom. The shower runs.  16.
(into phone) What? Sorry, Mom, I’m kind of ina sex haze... (beat) Hmm. I don’t know, I’11 ask her. Audrey, have you ever been with an uncircumcised guy?
Morgan!

Audrey thinks I tell you guys too much... I know! I think it’s healthy too. But yeah, I know most European guys are uncircumcised. Like when I first saw it I was like, ew this looks like an unbaked crescent roll. But then it’s like when it’s in there, the whole thing expands and it feels like -- I know this doesn’t sound like it would feel good -- but it’s like your insides are covered in scotch tape. Wait, duh, you already know this, Mom. You did a year abroad.

head_text.subj: MORGAN HANG UP THE FUCKING PHONE

text: I’1l call you back. (hangs up) Jesus. What?
These guys from the CIA came to Trader Joe’s today. To talk about Drew. They said... he's a spy. Morgan cracks up, assuming she’s kidding.
I'm serious. They showed me pictures of him with like, weapons and dead bodies. People he killed.
Wait. What?!
I know it sounds fucking batshit. But think about it. There were just so many unanswered questions with that guy...  17.
Yeah there were. Like if he really went to Vassar, why does he pronounce it Liberry? (then) Oh my fucking God!
Thank you! That is the appropriate reaction!
No. Behind you! Audrey turns. DREW is on the fire escape, wresting the wi open. He smiles. Ugh. It's a charming fucking smile.
Hey.
(reeling) Hi...
So you have my stuff?
Yeah... Then Audrey snaps out of it, remembers how angry she’s be
Wait, that’s all you have to say? What happened to you explaining everything?
I will, just right now I’m ina rush. Where’s the stuff? Your room? He just heads for her room. Audrey follows, pissed off.
Stop. You can’t just go in there. INT. AUDREY’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Audrey walks in to find Drew grabbing THE BOX on the floo She shuts the door behind him. They share a silent look.
Hey. Asshole. We’re not together. There are like, rules.  18.
(re: the box) This smells like lighter fluid.
Yeah. I wasn’t kidding when I said I was gonna burn your shit. But Drew just keeps moving, back to...
Audrey follows Drew as he heads back to the window. This all happening so fast. But it’s her last chance to say it
I know you’re a spy. This finally stops Drew. His face drops. He turns around.
People from the CIA came to my work. They made me get in a van and showed me pictures of people you killed.
What did you tell them?
You're not gonna give me a bullshit excuse about how this is a joke your coworkers are playing on you? And those pictures were photoshopped?
Audrey...
It was fucking scary, Drew. Drew is PANICKED. Checks windows, behind doors, opens the closet. Then, he pulls a HANDGUN out of his jacket.
Jesus! Fuck.
Audrey. Listen to me. I need to know exactly what you told them.
(confused) What’s on your head?
What?  19.

You have a red dot on your head. Sure enough, there’s a LASER SIGHT right between Drew's e GUNSHOTS -- BANG -- shattering windows. Drew springs to action, SHOVES AUDREY behind the COUCH -- pulls them both down and holds her close. It’s weirdly intimate.

What the fuck is going on? Then she sees the BLOOD. Drew’s been shot twice in the CH But he’s ALIVE. Audrey GASPS-- INT. MORGAN’S BEDROOM - SAME Morgan is still on the phone again as she gets dressed.
What the fuck was that?! (then) Dad, I have to call you back. INT. AUDREY AND MORGAN’S LIVING ROOM - SAME BEHIND THE SOFA. GUNFIRE doesn’t let up. Drew speaks, urg
Audrey... bad people are after me--
The CIA guys?

There’s more than just the CIA chasing me. And now they’re after you too. Fuck. This is exactly what I didn’t want -- you in danger. That’s why I broke up with you. Before Audrey can respond, Drew reaches into the box and pulls out his FANTASY FOOTBALL TROPHY.

But we’re in this together now. And a lot of innocent people are gonna die if we don’t bring this where it needs to go. So listen. We’re gonna leave this apartment, we’re gonna fly to Vienna, and give this to someone named Verne at the Hotel Sacher Cafe at 6pm tomorrow...
Why are you telling me this if we're going together?  20.
In case I don’t make it out of here alive. Verne. 6pm. Hotel Sacher Cafe. Then you'll be safe. And so will everyone else. Got it?
Drew, you’re not gonna die --
Listen. Don’t trust anybody. The bathroom door opens and VIKTOR appears in the doorway TOTALLY NAKED. CLOSE ON: HIS WEIRD UNCIRCUMCISED DICK.
Eughhhhhh! Viktor pulls out a GUN, SHOOTS Drew in the HEART point bl Audrey’s next... THEN. Morgan RUNS out of her room like a banshee. PLOWS i Viktor full force, shoving him into --

Before he can catch his balance, she pushes Viktor out th open window. He SCREAMS as he FALLS to his death. Audrey and Morgan are in total shock. Drew is dead! The shooting’s stopped -- But only because they now hear a BATTALION OF FOOTSTEPS running up the stairs.
We have to get the fuck out of here!
Oh my God, Drew!

We have to go. Now! As they BOLT for the FIRE ESCAPE, Audrey yanks the FOOTBA TROPHY out of Drew’s dead hands. She spots a wad of FOREI BILLS in his jacket. Stuffs them in her pockets. Overwhelmed, Audrey gives Drew one last look. Is there something she could have done? But it’s too late now. ANGLE on the DOOR as a SWARM of SPECIAL FORCES PERSONNEL burst in, led by SEBASTIAN and PATEL. But the girls are gone.  21. I/E. AUDREY’S HONDA CIVIC - DAY Audrey, shaking, fighting tears, drives as fast as she ca not terribly fast. A conservative driver. Morgan’s shotgu
Where are we going?!
I don’t know. Give me a minute. Okay. Where would we be safe?
Pull into this parking lot. There’s a bathroom in Pilates Plus.
We’re not hiding in fucking Pilates Plus! Where’s the police station? I think I voted there...
We can’t go to the police. I just killed someone. And I have a ton of unpaid speeding tickets. And... Black Lives Matter.
You killed someone in self-defense. That doesn’t count.
Just call those CIA agents.
Drew said we can’t trust anyone. And he’s right. He’s dead. Probably because I talked to them.
Or because I brought an assassin into our apartment.
Okay so it’s both our faults. Audrey slows as she approaches a STOP SIGN.

Go! Why are you stopping at stop signs? People are after us. Audrey nervously SPEEDS through the stop sign. Then her PHONE RINGS on the BLUETOOTH. BLOCKED NUMBER. Sh inhales, picks it up. It plays through the CAR SPEAKERS.  22.
Audrey? It’s Sebastian.
You killed Drew. I told you where he was gonna be and you killed him.
Who is this asshole?
Are you in the car? (no response) What did Drew say to you?
Why would I tell you anything after everything you’ve done?
Audrey. Where are you taking it? Audrey eyes the TROPHY, on the car’s console.
Give us the package. Trust me.
I don’t trust anyone anymore. Audrey HANGS UP. A moment.
You trust me though, right?
Of course. Not counting you.
Good. Cause this isn’t like, a fake spy friendship that the Russians put together.
Dude, shut up. I know. (grabbing the trophy) Drew said a lot of people are gonna die if we don’t deliver this.
What people?
He didn’t get that far. But he was like, lying on the floor about to die when he said it. I know he lied about a lot of shit, but like... (MORE )
if I don’t do what he said and a bunch of people die, in a terrorist attack or whatever, I will always wonder if I could have stopped it. Morgan thinks about this.
That would fucking suck. (beat) What did he say we have to do?
Bring this to some cafe in Vienna.
Vienna? As in, Austria, Vienna?
That’s what he said.
Then... why don’t we do that?
Why don’t we go to Europe when people are trying to kill us?
They’re trying to kill us here too.
But we’re just like, regular people. Yes, we happen to be in this extreme situation right now but we are not qualified to like... do some international spy mission.

It doesn’t sound like a whole “mission.” It’s just doing this one thing. Versus staying here and getting killed. Plus, you’ve never been to Europe. Do you really want to die never having gone to Europe? Or do you want to go to Europe and die, having been to Europe?
Why are those my only two options?
I don’t know, cause you dated a spy?
You fucked an assassin.  24.
That I did. Morgan opens the GLOVE COMPARTMENT, pulls out PASSPORTS.
I’m just saying. Our passports are still in here from our road trip to Mexico. And I have my dad’s credit card for emergencies...
(beat) Are we going to Austria?
I think we’re going to Austria. Audrey sharp-turns on to the FREEWAY ON-RAMP.
But we should ditch our phones. Bad guys can track us with our phones. Even if the phone is off.
How do you know that?
I went to summer camp with Edward Snowden. (proudly) First hand job. Oh my God that guy was obsessed with me. She grabs Audrey’s phone and fishes hers from her bag.
And he was really into ska.
Weird.

Right? When that whole thing was going down, I was like - hello, why is no one talking about how Edward Snowden is really into ska? Morgan THROWS THEIR PHONES OUT THE WINDOW into the opposi lane. Watches in the rearview as CARS CRUSH THEM.
Do you think my Candy Crush progress will be saved?  25.
Yeah, in the cloud. You linked your account with Facebook, right?
No. I don’t like getting all those notifications. (mournful ) Fuck. I/E. 405 FREEWAY/AUDREY’S HONDA CIVIC - DAY Audrey starts to pull off at an EXIT.
Why are you getting off here?
To park.
Dude, people are trying to kill us. We are not fucking parking in Lot C.

Mid-flight. Audrey and Morgan sit next to each other, eye all fellow passengers suspiciously. Wondering who might b threat. A WELL-DRESSED BUSINESSMAN. A PROFESSORIAL TYPE i bow-tie. Everyone in between. A FLIGHT ATTENDANT passes.
Could I get a Pinot Grigio please? The Flight Attendant nods and leaves.
You can’t drink right now!

I have to. This is so fucking stressful. Like, any of these people could be trying to kill us. She makes eye contact with a LITTLE GIRL across the aisle The little girl stares back stoically. Morgan’s freaked o
Morgan. We need all our faculties.
(re: her screen) That guy just drank like three martinis. Reveal she’s watching a BOND MOVIE. Audrey’s watching BOU  26.
He’s been doing this a really long time. This is our first time.
Do you think Drew was a James Bond kind of spy?
I don’t know. I don’t think James Bond would like, need to try every breakfast burrito in Los Angeles.
Yeah. Seems more like a Bourne thing.
Are your parents gonna be pissed that we used their credit card?
Not if I tell them why. That’s our family policy. As long as I tell the truth, they can’t get mad.
Morgan. You can’t tell them the truth about this.
(deeply conflicted) What if I tell them we went to Europe to go to museums?
You just said you weren’t supposed to lie!
It won't be a lie if we go toa museum. (off Audrey’s look) As long as we're there! We drop off the trophy at this cafe, that’s like an hour, tops. And then one museum.
We'll play it by ear. The wine arrives. Morgan gulps it down. Audrey shakes her head and puts on her headphones, focusing on her movie. ANGLE ON: BOURNE in a kickass action sequence... and we..
Audrey and Drew stand close at the jukebox, scrolling.  27.
Oh God. That Sarah McLachlan song. This is the one in the commercial where the dogs are sad, right?
I think the sad dogs redeem the song. Ugh, what about Mambo No. 5?
Please. That’s nothing compared to Mambos one through four. Audrey laughs. They’re enjoying each other.

Oh. Oh my God I have it. Close your eyes. Don’t look. Drew closes his eyes. Audrey gleefully puts the quarter i THE CRASH TEST DUMMIES “MMM MMM MMM MMM” plays. Drew open his eyes. Without missing a beat, starts singing along in lead singer’s super-deep bass.
“Oooooonce there was this kiitid who / got into an accident and couldn’t come to school / But wheeen he finally caaaame back... ” Audrey laughs, totally smitten.
The gorgeous sights of Vienna flash by as the girls sit i CAB heading across town. The driver is a middle-aged eleg AUSTRIAN WOMAN. Morgan and Audrey whisper.
She hasn’t smiled once. Do you think she’s an assassin?
No. We just randomly picked this cab. And she’s like, delicate.
Dude. Sexist! Women of all shapes and sizes can be anything they want to be. They can be assassins... (points to themselves) They can be operatives.  28.
I wouldn’t say we’re “operatives.” This is just one operation.
Yeah. But you and me? We’re always operating. Morgan notices something out the window. She GASPS in sho
Oh my GOD.
(scared) What? What?!?!
That building is fucking beautiful.
An ornate European restaurant packed with high-end touris and locals. Audrey and Morgan sit tensely in a corner tab subtly checking everyone out as they eat SACHERTORTES.
Okay. Who do we think Verne is?
I don’t know. It’s kind of a frumpy name.
You think? We might just be pronouncing it frumpy. Like, Jules Verne wasn’t frumpy.
I beg to differ. And wait, won't this guy be looking for Drew?
Yes. Shit. He will. A beat as they scan... then Morgan suddenly TENSES UP.
What? What do you see?
Nothing... (sighs) Okay, I know being here right now is really important but this cake is a lot of flour and dairy for me and... I need to go have diarrhea. (MORE )
It’s just a biological fact. No matter who you are, no matter how high the stakes in a given moment, sometimes you have to-
Oh my God just go.
Thank you. I'll be right back. Morgan rushes toward the bathroom. We stay with Audrey as BUTCH WAITRESS approaches.
Anything else?

Zwei Kaffee, bitte. Before Audrey knows what’s happening, SEBASTIAN emerges f behind her, takes Morgan’s seat. Audrey’s about to SCREAM SEBASTIAN (CONT’D) Don’t scream. I’m the person you’re here to see.
(confused) You're Verne?
It’s an alias. (then) Hand it over. Audrey hedges.
If Drew wanted me to give this to you, why wouldn’t he have done it himself?
It’s a long story.
I’m not in a rush. Then something touches her leg under the table. A GUN.
Oh my God!
Don’t make any noise. Just hand it over. I’m not gonna hurt you. I’m trying to protect you.
Like you protected Drew?
That wasn’t us. We didn’t do that.
If you were really protecting me, you wouldn't be pointing a gun at me. I may not be in the fucking CIA but I know that.
I’m MI-6, actually.
Whatever.
Morgan washes her hands next to their WAITRESS. She smile politely. Then Morgan double-takes. The waitress’s NAME TAG -- VERNE.
You're Verne?
Guttentag! Morgan rushes out of the bathroom, back to --

Morgan FREEZES, seeing Sebastian at the table with Audrey She waves -- tries to get Audrey’s attention. Audrey sees but doesn’t react. The gun’s still trained on her. AT THEIR TABLE -- Sebastian continues to explain.

I’m only pointing this at you so you sit still and listen. Ina minute, everyone in this cafe is going to start shooting. If you run, you'll be killed. And even if you manage to get out alive, you won’t be able to go anywhere. (MORE )
If you scan your passport at a border, there’1l be men with guns a lot bigger than this one who won’t say a word before they shoot you in the face. So hand me what I want and no one gets hurt.
Except for Drew.
Okay, it’s not productive to keep bringing that up. Audrey has no choice. She reaches into her POCKET and gra the TROPHY. She starts to hand it over, when -- Morgan -- seeing this -- SCREAMS.

THAT’S. NOT. VERNE! CHAOS ERUPTS! Almost everyone in the cafe has a gun, and of them start SHOOTING. Sebastian whips around, SHOOTS BA A DEAD ASSASSIN plummets into an elaborate ROAST CHICKEN. A DEAD VERNE FALLS ON TOP OF AUDREY, GUN in her dead hand Morgan drops to the ground, hides under a TABLE... thinki fast, Audrey GRABS Verne’s GUN. Crouching, scans for Morg just as -- an ARYAN-LOOKING MAN with a RIFLE stalks Morga prepares to end her short, wonderful life... Audrey acts on instinct, aims with precision -- just like Duck Hunt -- and BLOWS THE GUY’S BRAINS OUT. Saving her. Morgan looks up, shocked, grateful. AUDREY’s surprised to She stares at the gun in her hands -- SHE’S GOOD AT THIS. Then a GUTTURAL SCREAM from behind them-- Sebastian throw SCALDING HOT COFFEE on an attacker, stabs a FORK in his n While he’s distracted, Audrey and Morgan fucking run for
Audrey and Morgan sprint down the alley, panicking...
I just killed someone... oh my god Morgan, I just killed someone...
Don’t think about it! Keep running!
I_killed someone!  32.

Stop yelling that! Up ahead, an OLDER RICH COUPLE -- dressed for a night at OPERA -- are climbing into their VINTAGE M.G. when -- AUDREY and MORGAN run up behind them like crazy people. Audrey SNATCHES THE MAN’S KEYS right out of his hand.
Was machst Du da fiir ScheiBe! Audrey pushes into the car. Morgan gets in the passenger
They lock the doors. Audrey hastily turns the car on. The and Woman scream -- YELL for POLICE -- banging on the windows. Audrey looks down -- A GEAR SHIFT.
Shit. Can you drive a stick?
No! What?! Do I look like a fifty- five year old man?

The M.G. rolls VERY SLOWLY down the street in NEUTRAL. Th OLDER COUPLE easily keeps up on foot, banging on the wind The car SLOWLY rolls into a NEWSSTAND, barely nudging it. But PAPERS fall, on to the windshield. Blocking their vie
Fuck. Come on. The girls jump out, apologizing profusely as they run.
Sorry/ so sorry!
The girls dash around a corner --
Get in there! She gestures to an UBER decal on a WAITING CAR. They jump
Driving. LUKAS, pierced and bohemian, at the wheel.  33.
Go go go go go! Go! Go! Lukas stares at HIS PHONE: A picture of an ASIAN MAN.
Mr. Nguyen?
Yes. Mr. Nguyen. Just go! Audrey throws a bunch of BILLS at him. Lukas shrugs and drives. Typical Uber chatter ensues.
So you guys visiting? The girls’ eyes dart everywhere -- frantic -- not listeni
(panicking) Can we go another way? There’s a lot of traffic here --
Bottled water? Still? Sparkling?
No! Just drive --

You have enough air back there? A GUY ON A MOTORCYCLE PULLS ALONGSIDE THEM -- full-head h obscuring his face. He LIFTS a MACHINE GUN. Ready to fire Audrey and Morgan SCREAM. Audrey reaches over and kicks h own LEG down on top of Lukas’s -- SPEEDING THE CAR UP.
Here’s the deal, okay? Some guys with guns are trying to kill us right now. Can you just, lose them?
(lighting up) Fuck yeah! Lukas starts driving like a MANIAC. EFFECTIVELY. He makes SHARP TURN, losing the assassin. The girls exhale. Until:

Good thing I smoked a little meth before. Fear is an illusion! He turns down a ONE-WAY STREET. The wrong way. CARS HONK, pull to the side. Lukas swerves in and out... on to nearb TRAIN TRACKS. He drives down the tracks at top speed...  34. bumping wildly... heads into a NARROW TUNNEL. In the dark the lights of an ONCOMING TRAIN appear...
Lukas!
I see it. No problem. Lukas SPEEDS UP. The girls SCREAM at the top of their lungs... The Uber pulls out of the tunnel and off to the JUST IN THE NICK OF TIME -- The TRAIN rushes by.

Up here! Lukas lifts a hand to HIGH-FIVE. Before they can return i BLAM! -- BLAM!! THE BACK WINDOW shatters! THE GIRLS -- du LUKAS -- is sprayed with bullets. He DIES TEN TIMES OVER. MORGAN lifts her head cautiously over the back seat... FI MORE MOTORCYCLE GUYS are racing through the tunnel, armed

Audrey, get on top of him! Audrey jumps on the LAP of Lukas’s DECIMATED CORPSE. She DRIVES, cautious at first... then gets an ADRENALINE RUSH Drives FASTER AND FASTER. When she gets to a CROSSING, sh TURNS off the tracks, into TRAFFIC -- Weaving between car Audrey is a quick fucking study. She makes a SHARP TURN. Loses her pursuers. For now.

Hey! Pull over! Stop the car! A BAROQUE SIGN AHEAD -- STEPHANSPLATZ. METRO STATION. Aud pulls up to the curb. Morgan jumps out. Audrey climbs off Lukas’ dead body. Glances back at him one more time...
(ruefully) Five stars. Five stars, Lukas. They sprint toward the Metro. SIRENS in the distance.
AUDREY and MORGAN run down the ESCALATOR, to the TURNSTIL
Jump the turnstile! Audrey stops. There’s a COP patrolling nearby.  35.
POUNDING MUSIC FROM THEIR CHASE continues as the girls tr work the confusing METRO PASS DISPENSER.
Gah! Fucking take my Euro!
Music continues as they keep swiping their cards to no avail... they keep getting an ERROR MESSAGE: FEHLER! FEHL Finally, they get through. Slip into a METRO CAR.

Audrey and Morgan collapse on to seats, breathless. Final The train moves. They look up -- A VERY PREGNANT WOMAN an ELDERLY MAN. Audrey and Morgan exchange a look and give u their seats. Hold the bars as they continue panting.
An industrial underground complex with SCREENS everywhere
SEBASTIAN -- still in his bloody shirt -- enters the SITUATION ROOM. Patel sees him, breaks from a conversatio with WENDY (50s), their permanently-disgruntled BOSS.
Great job, Henshaw! (deadpan) Your mission was to have everyone in that cafe die and the girls get away, right? Sebastian ignores PATEL, turns to Wendy.
Extenuating circumstances.
They had the package and you didn’t get it. Explain that circumstance.
I was trying to protect them.
Why? Let them die. They’re idiots. I know an idiot when I see one.  36.
(sotto) In the mirror.
I’m not an idiot, Sebastian. I was--
Harvard. Yes. We know.

(stern) Boys. If I wanted to sit here with two children, I'd spend time with my own children. And I don’t want to spend time with my own children. Now what do we know about these idiots? PATEL leans over and types a few keys. ON THE SCREENS -- PHOTOS of AUDREY and MORGAN.

Audrey Stockman. 27. Works at Trader Joe's. (to Sebastian) You're right. Can’t let anything happen to her. Who else would serve the samples of Vegan Gyoza? (to Wendy) She’s worked there since she graduated from Oberlin with a B minus average. Which is where she met this genius... MORGAN’s PICTURE.
Or shall I say “This Musical Theater major who designed her own minor.”
In what?
She literally minored in “Personality.”
What’s your point, Patel? You’re okay letting two innocent women die?
I think society is okay letting these two die. They’re losers. And we'll catch them the minute they try to cross the border. (MORE )
These girls are the stupidest people America hasn’t managed to kill yet.
An uber-modern mall-like International hub.
AUDREY grabs two tickets and hurries through the CROWD, keeping her head down, lying low... she arrives
Just as MORGAN emerges with a BAG. The girls walk quickly
Keep moving. There are cameras everywhere.
I got us changes of clothes. Morgan pulls out two BASEBALL HATS with MOZART’S FACE.
They really play up that Mozart’s from here. Really downplay that Hitler’s from here. The girls put on the hats and head for the tracks.
What else did you get?
Everything that said Wiener on it. She shows Audrey a jar of VIENNA SAUSAGES and a cake labe TORTE WIENER ART. Then Audrey suddenly STOPS.
Wait. Fuck. Our passports. Sebastian said we'll get stopped if we try to use them.

Okay. So we just have to get new ones. Let’s find a couple of girls who look like us, tell them what happened and convince them to give us theirs. They can just go to the embassy and say theirs were stolen.
Who would do that for us?  38.
Any girls! It’s girl code. Eat Pray Love.
They look kinda like us. She points to two KIND OF NERDY GIRLS who look like them.
Babe, what are you talking about? Those girls look nothing like us. Those girls look like us. Morgan points to two TALL BACKPACKERS WHO LOOK LIKE MODEL
By the TRACKS -- Audrey and Morgan are nearly in TEARS as they explain their predicament to the AUSTRALIAN BACKPACK
... Just think about the only guy you've ever really loved dying in front of you. And asking you to do this one thing for him. Wouldn’t you sacrifice anything?
Yeah, I mean this was my favorite shirt. It’s H&M but now it’s also B&B. Blood and Brains.
You guys are weird.
We're not... (mocking Australian accent) weeeeeid. We're serious. You’d be saving our lives. And a lot of other innocent people. You don’t want those people to die, right?
Please guys. Just go to the embassy and get new passports. We’ll give you some money for your time --
Sorry. We’d love to help you out, mate, but we don’t know you and...
No, I get it. I get it.  39. The TRAIN pulls in behind them. Morgan and Audrey exchang look. They both know what they have to do.
Thanks anyway. It was beautiful meeting you two.
Have a great time in Poland. They pull the two Backpackers in for a HUG...

(yelling) Now! AUDREY and MORGAN GRAB the girls’ FANNY PACKS and dash fo the WAITING TRAIN. Before the Aussies know what’s happeni the train has left the station. Along with their passport PRE-LAP thumping ETHEREAL HOUSE MUSIC...

Dizzying strobe lights -- thumping bass -- an AVANT GARDE runway show in a drafty PALACE BALLROOM. Androgynous men women move stiffly down the catwalk in clothes that look armor. Vacant faces STREAKED with black and metallic pain

We track one MODEL -- 6’3, deathly pale, beauty that only exists in unpronounceable countries. NADEJDA (pronounced “Nadia” but everything, including spelling, is harder whe she’s from.) She completes her walk and heads back to --
The bullpen. Nadedja ignores the chatter of models and interns as she goes to a CUBBY, removes an expensive leat bag. Pulls out her BUZZING PHONE. In a heavy SLAVIC accen
Hello... Yes... I understand. She crosses behind a CURTAIN, pulls it shut.
Nadedja strips NAKED, revealing a bony, hairless body. Sh pulls out the components of -- A GUN. Assembles it expertly. From outside the curtains -  40.

Nadedja? You’re not changing, are you? Carlo wants everyone out there. Nadedja continues, unperturbed by the request. Moves on t HANDGUN -- screws in a SILENCER. The curtain is YANKED OPEN, revealing the CHUBBY MALE INT MALE INTERN (CONT’D) Carlos said now -- HOLY SHIT. His eyes widen, taking in the nudity -- luckier than he’s ever been in his life. And ever will be. Because he’s abo to die. He should not have seen those guns. Nadedja moves like lightning -- AIMS, FIRES. Intern FALLS She pulls a shapeless FROCK from a nearby rack, checks he reflection in a mirror. Uses a MAKEUP SPONGE to wipe the Intern’s blood off her face, steps over him in her stilet

Nadedja climbs into a MERCEDES SLR MACLAREN -- mirrored exterior, as otherworldly as she is. This is like, a 650K car (given the current European economy, you could negoti down to six, but Nadedja doesn’t negotiate.) She speeds a
Gorgeous countryside. Audrey and Morgan -- now in differe clothes -- sit in a TRAIN COMPARTMENT. Morgan holds the TROPHY, Audrey removes a PHONE from one of the FANNY PACK
We should get you a gun. Cause dude. Back there? In that cafe? You're like, deadly.
I play a lot of Duck Hunt.
(re: trophy) God, what is the fucking deal with this thing?
I don’t know. That’s what we have to figure out.
Or maybe... we don’t. I mean, Drew asked you to hand it to this one person. We tried. (MORE )

People shot at us. And each other. Clearly this isn’t as easy as we thought. Maybe we should just like... throw it out the window. Then it’s just... not on us. Audrey thinks about it. Tempting, but she just can’t.
No. If it’s really that important and we just ditch it and something really bad happens... I don’t want that blood on my hands. In addition to the literal blood that’s already all over my hands.
That train station hand soap is for shit.
We just have to get out of this country of murderers. We'll be in Prague in a few hours.
Prague does not sound free of murderers. But Audrey's distracted, clicking around on one of the Aussie’s CELL PHONES with a bejeweled pot leaf case.
What are you looking at?
Facebook. Photos of me and Drew. He’s looking away in every picture. How did I never notice that before?
When you’re in love you don’t see shit you don’t want to see. Are those his parents? ANGLE on a photo of Audrey and Drew -- head turned -- wit MIDDLE AGED MIDWESTERN-LOOKING couple. TOM and MARSHA.
Yeah. I met them the night before he disappeared. We all went to the Cheesecake Factory.
God, that menu. Too many options.  42.
I know. We ended up splitting a lot of things.
Do you think they knew?
I don’t know who knows anything anymore. All I know is I really fucking liked that guy...
The CRASH TEST DUMMIES song is still playing. Audrey and SLOW-DANCE in the bar, half-ironic, Junior High-style.

I don’t know. Like my best friend always knew she wanted to be an actress. And she’s just... a natural at it. I’ve never had anything like that. I’ve never had a thing where people are like, “Audrey, this is what you were born to do.”
You will.
How do you know? You just met me.
I’m a good judge of character. Audrey smiles. A moment. Are they going to kiss? Then the song FADES OUT, breaking the moment.
Anyway, thanks for the dance.

You too. Audrey heads back to MORGAN, drinking at the bar... DREW (CONT’D) Actually, wait. (she turns around) Let’s play it again. Drew pulls a TWENTY out of his wallet. DREW (CONT’D) Like, a lot of times. Audrey laughs, delighted.  43.
Passports?

CLOSE on two stern-looking CZECH SOLDIERS studying the AUSTRALIAN GIRLS’ PASSPORTS. They look up and we -- RACK FOCUS to AUDREY and MORGAN, smiling innocently from their seats. Morgan speaks in a HEAVY AUSTRALIAN ACCENT.
Hi! Name’s Briony! As you can tell by my accent, I grew up in Perth. Though I live in Sydney now. Audrey chimes in awkwardly... in a TEXAS DRAWL.
Great uniforms! Thanks y’all! The guards stamp their passports and hand them back. Move Audrey and Morgan slide the door shut and exhale.
I can’t believe that worked.
Me neither. You sounded like if Matthew McConaughey had a stroke.
Wait. I just thought of something.
What? Audrey picks up the TROPHY. BASHES IT against the armrest
What are you doing?! What if that’s like, a bomb?
No way. We went through airport security. Twice. Sure enough, the trophy CRACKS. There’s a FLASH DRIVE ins
Oh my God, dude. Audrey! You are such an operative right now.
I bet we’ll know what to do and where to go if we can just figure out what’s on this thing.
She pulls out the drive, discards the trophy.
But we don’t have our laptops. And even if we did, I’m sure it’s like, top secret stuff in code or whatever. We’d need some computer genius to figure it out for us...
The iconic APPLE image above the GENIUS BAR.
A CZECH VERSION of an AMERICAN COMPUTER GEEK -- GAUGED ea kinda cool, kinda not. NEON GREEN tee. He holds the drive

It’s not something we sell. But let's take a look! He opens the nearest LAPTOP and plugs the drive into the port. A STREAM OF NUMBERS AND LETTERS APPEAR. CZECH GENIUS (CONT’D) Wow. This is something I have not seen before. Let me ask Lubos...
NINE GENIUSES huddle over the laptop. No other customers being helped. The STORE MANAGER shakes his head.
I’ve never seen anything like this. This is some serious government Mr. Robot shit. Where did you get this?
Uh, Best Buy? My Grandma Rose... who works at Best Buy. LUBOS -- ENORMOUS, BEARDED -- pipes up.
Wait. Here’s something... (he clicks) What if we open up this guy... The Geniuses nod, mutter their agreement. ALL POWER IN THE APPLE STORE goes OUT. THE COMPUTERS SMOK  45.
What the fuck... ?
(to Morgan) Fuck. Get the drive! Get it out! In the darkness, Morgan GRABS THE FLASH DRIVE. They RUN.
In the bullpen, on a COMPUTER SCREEN, a NOTIFICATION FLAS on a DIGITAL MAP. A TECH shouts to the room:
Prague! They’re in Prague.
Nadedja -- intense EDM blasting -- SPEEDS down a highway.
The iconic bridge. Packed with tourists, vendors, caricat artists. Morgan and Audrey move through the crowd. Morgan holds the Aussie’s POT LEAF PHONE.
I just want to tell them I’m safe! I haven’t gone a day without talking to my parents, like, ever.
Fine. But you cannot tell them what’s going on.
I can’t lie. That’s our deal. If I tell the truth, they can’t get mad.
They might get mad this time.
They didn’t get mad when I tried cocaine with our rabbi. They didn’t get mad when I blew the homeless guy.
You didn’t know he was homeless though.
That’s what they said! Trust me. It’s better to have someone know where we are right now.  46. Audrey sighs but doesn’t argue as Morgan steps aside, dia The phone rings. Morgan’s mom CAROL answers.
Hello?
Mom! It’s me. INT. CAROL AND ARNIE’S LIVING ROOM - DAY- INTERCUT CAROL (50s) sits at the kitchen table in their suburban h cutting an ARTICLE out of the Asbury Park Press.
Oh thank God. Arnie, she’s okay! Honey you’re all over the news. REVEAL the article is about AUDREY and MORGAN. “FREEHOLD NATIVE AND FRIEND SOUGHT IN INT’L MURDER CONSPIRACY”.
I’m conferencing your father in. INT. CAROL AND ARNIE’S BATHROOM - SAME- INTERCUT ARNIE (50s) is on the toilet, on his cell.
Honey? This is Dad. Where are you? Did you and Audrey murder two people? That’s what they said on Channel Seven.
No! I mean yes I killed someone but he was an assassin. And then Audrey killed someone in Austria. But that was self-defense...
You’re in Austria?!
Arnie, get out of the bathroom. I can hear the echo. A FLUSH.
Oh God, mute yourself. Your father’s a pig.
A LISTENING STATION picks up a HIT. A map of NEW JERSEY w a blinking dot over FREEHOLD. Another TECH traces the cal  47.
Charles Bridge. Prague.
AUDREY nervously looks around at passersby, suspecting everyone. Morgan is still absorbed in her PHONE CALL. INT. CAROL AND ARNIE’S BEDROOM - SAME - INTERCUT Arnie is now sitting on the bed.
...And we can’t go to the police because they might be in on this. That’s what we’re trying to figure out right now.
Where are you staying tonight?
We hadn’t gotten that far...
Listen. I have a friend. Roger Bernstein. Ophthalmologist. Met him doing Doctors Without Borders. He’s got a big place in Prague. Lotta money, that guy. Married a Czech woman. Beautiful girl. Zaftig.
Arnie.
She left him but he stayed on. I think he likes the culture.
Sexually adventurous.
He'll behave. I’11 give him a call.

NADEDJA stands on top of BUILDING, behind a SNIPER RIFLE. looks through her sight at -- THE CHARLES BRIDGE. Nadedja pauses. Makes a CALL. The voice on the other end speaks through a VOICE MODULATOR.  48.
Who am I looking for?
I texted pictures. Targets are two dumb American women. Nadedja looks on her phone. Pictures of AUDREY and MORGAN She looks through her sight again. THROUGH THE CROSSHAIRS

head_text.subj: MANY PAIRS OF DUMB AMERICAN WOMEN --

text: Two SLUTTY GIRLS take duck-face Selfies. A DRUNK CHICK pukes over the side of the bridge while her HUNG-OVER FRIEND holds her hair back. Two girls HUMP a statue of JESUS, cracking each other up. OFF NADEDJA -- she has no idea who to shoot.
Audrey, sensing DANGER, leans over to Morgan.
(into phone) Wait, there are Ophthalmologists in Doctors Without Borders?
We should go.
What, you think people in Afghanistan don’t have astigmatism?
Your judgment is also a border, young lady. Audrey GRABS THE PHONE and THROWS IT OFF THE BRIDGE.
We have to fucking go!

The girls race CITY BIKES through Prague, passing Cathedr Museums, etc. Not stopping to see the sights. I/E ROGER’S HOUSE - NIGHT Audrey and Morgan POUND ON THE ORNATE WOODEN DOOR as they glance behind them, paranoid. Finally it opens. ROGER (50 cardigan, balding, benign -- appears.  49.
Whoa there! One of you must need the bathroom. Morgan and Audrey just hurry inside and slam the door.
Yeah. Sorry. Nice to meet you.
(to Audrey) You must be Morgan! You've got your mother’s face.
Actually... I’m Morgan.
Audrey.
Audrey, has anyone ever told you you've got Morgan’s mother’s face? The uncle humor relaxes them a bit. Roger leads the way upstairs - but the girls linger, glancing at the door.
Mind if I lock the door... ?

Nervous traveler, eh? (she nods) Come on. Let’s go help you relax. He WINKS as he locks the bolt. The girls cringe a little. INT. ROGER’S DINING ROOM - NIGHT At a candlelit table, Audrey and Morgan serve themselves salad. Roger enters from the kitchen.
You girls look like you’d enjoy some pot... He pulls a POT ROAST off the counter.
...Roast! He cracks himself up.
Thank you so much, Roger, I’m starving.  50. Audrey serves herself some but Morgan wrinkles her nose.
Oooh. Uh... I’m sort of vegan.
Oh. I wish I’d known...
It’s kind of a new thing.
Except when she gets really drunk and eats bacon-wrapped hot dogs off this gross cart.
Drunk Morgan doesn’t have the same ethics as sober Morgan.
Roger, this is delicious. You’re a great cook.
Morgan, I can’t let you eat salad for dinner. What kind of host would I be? I’11l just whip something up. He ducks back into the kitchen. A moment.
Am I crazy or is Roger into me?
Oh God. Audrey clutches her stomach.
I think I’m eating too fast. All this meat is hitting me weird.
That’s your body questioning your moral decisions.

I’m gonna find the bathroom. INT. ROGER’S HOUSE - BATHROOM - NIGHT Audrey, pale, clutching her stomach, races into the bathr and THROWS UP in the toilet.  51. INT. ROGER’S HOUSE - DINING ROOM - NIGHT Roger re-emerges with a dish of GRILLED EGGPLANT.
Here. Eat.
You know what? I’m good. I’m trying not to eat when I’m not hungry.
What happened to Audrey?
